word: It requires moral courage to take a position to keep the commandments of the Lord. An opposer of the truth once said that it was only weak-minded people . . . who would turn away from the churches to keep the seventh day as the Sabbath. But a minister who had embraced the truth replied, "If you think it takes weak-minded persons, just try it." It takes moral courage, firmness, decision, perseverance and very much prayer to step out on the unpopular side. . . .
